title: Dead Sea
summary: The Dead Sea (Hebrew: יָם הַמֶּלַח‎ Yam ha-Melah lit. Sea of Salt; Arabic: البحر الميت‎ Al-Bahr al-Mayyit, lit. the Dead Sea,[5] or Buhayrat,[6][7] Bahret or Birket Lut,[6] lit. "Lake/Sea of Lot") is a salt lake bordered by Jordan to the east and Israel and the West Bank to the west. It lies in the Jordan Rift Valley, and its main tributary is the Jordan River.
